dcterms:creator: Massimo Fornasier
Hui Huang
Lorenzo Pareschi
Philippe Sünnen
dcterms:description: The Ackley function is a well-known test function for optimization algorithms, characterized by its many local minima and a single global minimum. In this paper, it is used in the context of constrained optimization over hypersurfaces.
dcterms:title: Ackley function

dcterms:creator: Françoise Bolley
José A Canizo
José A Carrillo
dcterms:description: The Stochastic Kuramoto-Vicsek model describes the collective behavior of self-driven particles and is used to analyze swarming dynamics. In this paper, it serves as a foundational model for developing consensus-based optimization methods.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Kuramoto-Vicsek model

dcterms:creator: Pierre Degond
Sébastien Motsch
dcterms:description: The Kinetic Kolmogorov-Kuramoto-Vicsek model extends the Kuramoto-Vicsek model to a kinetic framework, allowing for a continuum description of particle interactions. It is referenced in the context of deriving mean-field limits for consensus-based optimization.
dcterms:title: Kinetic Kolmogorov-Kuramoto-Vicsek model

dcterms:creator: José A Carrillo
Massimo Fornasier
Jesús Rosado
Giuseppe Toscani
dcterms:description: The Cucker-Smale model describes the dynamics of a flock of particles that interact based on their positions and velocities. It is used in the paper to illustrate the convergence properties of consensus-based optimization methods.
dcterms:title: Cucker-Smale model

dcterms:creator: José A Carrillo
Young-Pil Choi
Claudia Totzeck
Oliver Tse
dcterms:description: Consensus-based optimization methods are a class of algorithms that utilize the consensus of multiple agents to find global optima in complex landscapes. This paper discusses their theoretical foundations and applications.
dcterms:title: Consensus-based optimization methods
